fields.text: I only feel angry when I see waste. When I see people throwing away things we could use.
fields.author: Mother Teresa

fields.text: The Earth is what we all have in common.
fields.author: Wendell Berry

fields.text: Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
fields.author: George Bernard Shaw

fields.text: Time spent among trees is never time wasted.
fields.author: Anonymous

fields.text: He that plants trees loves others besides himself.
fields.author: Thomas Fuller

fields.text: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.
fields.author: Margaret Mead

fields.text: One of the first conditions of happiness is that the link between man and nature shall not be broken.
fields.author: Leo Tolstoy

fields.text: The environment is where we all meet; where we all have a mutual interest; it is the one thing all of us share.
fields.author: Lady Bird Johnson

fields.text: Nature is painting for us, day after day, pictures of infinite beauty.
fields.author: John Ruskin

fields.text: Like music and art, love of nature is a common language that can transcend political or social boundaries.
fields.author: Jimmy Carter

fields.text: Nothing is more beautiful than the loveliness of the woods before sunrise.
fields.author: George Washington Carver

fields.text: A nation that destroys its soils destroys itself. Forests are the lungs of our land, purifying the air and giving fresh strength to our people.
fields.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

fields.text: What’s the use of a fine house if you haven’t got a tolerable planet to put it on.
fields.author: Henry David Thoreau

fields.text: The Earth is a fine place and worth fighting for
fields.author: Ernest Hemingway

fields.text: We have forgotten how to be good guests, how to walk lightly on the earth as its other creatures do.
fields.author: Barbara Ward

fields.text: The proper use of science is not to conquer nature but to live in it.
fields.author: Barry Commoner
